Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: casastyles
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel at the last mi ute through latestays.com that provides a better price then agoda and more accurate picture of the place you will stay. This is not a tourist place and dont promote this place as it. Its a transit hotel with a good location. Near mrt so easy to reach from the airport, 15 minutes by walk from orchard and the walk is in interesting since you will discover the university of art and other i terting things. You cannot get lost the way is really easy. You are near little india too. The other good thing you have near by a 7/11 and restaurants open 24 hours. Regarding the hotel i didnt expect much but at least you can get some sleep or rest after a busy day. You can hear everything from your room you hear people walking in the corridor and the other rooms on the same floor. I didnt find any sleep at all since this hotel even at 3 o'clock since to be busy by short stays guest "guy with girls." The room was small 20 sqm, the shower with the toilet but good point hot water but no pressure. They provide free internet that i needed this one reason i stay there coz in singapore they charge crazy prices for internet. So free internet is good when its working! It was working but u need to setup the password every twenty minutes. So annoying. I didnt upload any pictures since you got all already here. So please dont stop there for tourism, for one night transit its ok.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS NOT A HOTEL FOR TOURISTS”
Reviews.Author: Siglo5
Reviews.Content: We`ve stayed in this Hotel for two nights without sleep. OK the rooms are clean but very small. The mattresses are covered with a plastic film, thats hygienic but not comfortable to sleep. Now I know what the plastic-film is for. If you want to sleep in this hotel you need ear plugs, because of the noises from the other rooms. Many couples book this "Hotel" for just 2 hours to have fun. This fun ist very loud and the couples have an all-night party.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Spacious family room”
Reviews.Author: CGC1983
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the price I paid. Very good area, 3mins walk LITTLE india stn.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: lcf-guy
Reviews.Content: In the bare-bones singapore hotels, this seems the best of them. I liked it better than Fragrance-Selegie: better rooms, free-wifi, though no free (but bad) breakfast. The problem I had was the wifi generally was very bad, requiring constant re-login.

Reviews.Title: “Depending on your reason for stay, perfect for what you need”
Reviews.Author: ljv05
Reviews.Content: when booked i was looking for a hotel that i would only be in to sleep a couple hours a night. this hotel was perfect for that. very tiny rooms however it meet my needs of clean and very nice hotel staff. bottled water for free and rooms cleaned daily. if you want to come back to your room to relax for many hours in the day, do not pick. literally a bed, shower and tv in a box, however met my needs perfectly! Clean, firendly and 20 minute walk to the F1 track (raffles av)

Reviews.Title: “not bad, ok”
Reviews.Author: family guy f
Reviews.Content: small room like a dungeon, but ac working, location and price ok, wifi free, staf nice

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: masif
Reviews.Content: The best budget hotel, we were in the family hotel, very clean hotel, nice rooms, Small hotel but very nice, will definitely stay here again. Family room is very good, don't know above other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUDGET HOTEL WITH VERY SMALL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: sudhakar_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a family room which is very economical and good,but before checking in at 2pm , i was given a small room to fresh up which is literally a double room with only bed in the room and you cannot even open suit cases on the floor and they have charged 15dollars per hour,it was too small.But the family room which we had booking was good ,there is a indian restaurant which is very nearyby to the hotel which is of great advantage anand bhavan hotel i think .hotel is clean and good

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Abrahamwiccan
Reviews.Content: When i booked the hotel online, i thought that the pictures looked fantastic and that for the price of 129 Singaporean Dollar, it shall be good value for money. However, when i got there, the room was so small and the staff were very unfriendly. The Chinese man receptionist told me "go and look la" when i asked him for directions. I am still wondering what la means in English. Last but not the least, people were checking in for periods of two hours. I had trouble sleeping at night as there were plenty of noises in my neighbor's room. I just could not close my eyes at all and i was wondering when that woman or the guy next door will get tired. That was my experience.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was ok - but nothing for claustrophobians”
Reviews.Author: asiansummer10
Reviews.Content: veeeery small rooms !! the window was shadowed and covered with a heavy curtain and can't be opened (I am not sure but it could be that some rooms are without window). aircondtion cannot be turned off by yourself, you have to call the reception. the staff is very unfriendly, if you want an advice for the city you have to be patient and ask several times. we stayed two nights, and the second night we could not sleep until 3am because it was sooo noisy: we called the reception twice but nothing happened. no breakfast, no internet available, no safe. if you have a small budget and want to be in the center of singapore then I can recommend this hotel. but if you like a higher comfort and maybe spend some time of the day in your room - look for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny”
Reviews.Author: ando27
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff (recognised us when we arrived), prompt service when we required it. After reading the reviews it was pretty much what we had expected (apart from hearing so much noise from other guests ie. lift bell, doorbells, telephone ringing, doors banging and general chit-chat. Yes the rooms were small but posed no particular problem. Great location, would even stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable cell”
Reviews.Author: nambijin
Reviews.Content: Room very very small, not much floor space only the bed, however was clean and secure. Staff were very pleasant and friendly. Free broadband internet with my laptop really worked although there was not really any where to put the computer apart from the bed. Convenient to walk to Little India and the Bugis and Bras Basah areas. Good price for a place to rest while stopping on the way from Australia to Europe. Pillows did not have real pillow cases but I always travel with my own pillow. Previously stayed in Hotel 81 Joo Chiat in a deluxe room. Much better, more floor and proper window. Will try to choose something a little bigger next time but would stay again if I could not find anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and clean but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: avinashkalro
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on agoda.com, very reasonably prices, superb location. But, this is not for a family vacation. All rooms are extremely small. Surprisingly the rooms and bathrooms are very clean and maintained well. LCD TVs in all rooms. It is located very near the Little India MRT. Very close to Mustafa Plaza a 24 hours hyper market. Loads of Indian restaurants. The only 2 good things about this hotel is its location and its hygiene.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 81 Selegie
HotelInfo.Address: 161 Selegie Road, | Singapore, Singapore 188318, Singapore
